intro: Grevea madagascariensis subsp. madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascan grevea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its restricted range, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
